items.text: I feel restless and can't sit still.
items.rationale: Restlessness and inability to sit still are key indicators of agitation.

items.text: Others tell me I seem on edge all the time.
items.rationale: Being perceived as on edge by others is a sign of agitation.

items.text: I often pace around without a clear reason.
items.rationale: Pacing is a common behavior associated with agitation.

items.text: I find myself tapping my fingers or feet frequently.
items.rationale: Frequent tapping is a physical manifestation of agitation.

items.text: I feel like I need to move constantly.
items.rationale: A constant need to move is indicative of agitation.

items.text: I can't seem to relax, even in calm situations.
items.rationale: Inability to relax is a symptom of agitation.

items.text: I often feel like I'm about to jump out of my skin.
items.rationale: Feeling like jumping out of one's skin is a vivid description of agitation.

items.text: I get fidgety when I have to sit for long periods.
items.rationale: Fidgeting during long periods of sitting is a sign of agitation.

items.text: I feel a constant sense of urgency, even when there's no rush.
items.rationale: A constant sense of urgency is a psychological aspect of agitation.

items.text: I find myself clenching my fists or jaw without realizing it.
items.rationale: Clenching fists or jaw is a physical symptom of agitation.

items.text: I feel like I need to do something, but I don't know what.
items.rationale: Feeling the need to act without a clear goal is a sign of agitation.

items.text: I often feel like I'm in a hurry, even when I'm not.
items.rationale: Feeling hurried without reason is a psychological symptom of agitation.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I can't sit still, but it passes quickly.
items.rationale: Temporary inability to sit still can indicate agitation, but may also be situational.

items.text: I feel restless, but it might just be because I'm bored.
items.rationale: Restlessness due to boredom can mimic agitation but is not clinically significant.

items.text: I feel anxious and can't sit still.
items.rationale: Anxiety can cause restlessness, overlapping with agitation.

items.text: I've lost my appetite and don't feel like eating.
items.rationale: Loss of appetite is a direct indicator of changes in appetite.

items.text: I find myself eating much more than usual.
items.rationale: Increased eating is a clear sign of changes in appetite.

items.text: Food doesn't taste as good as it used to.
items.rationale: A change in taste perception can indicate changes in appetite.

items.text: I skip meals because I'm not hungry.
items.rationale: Skipping meals due to lack of hunger is a sign of decreased appetite.

items.text: I crave certain foods more than before.
items.rationale: Craving specific foods can indicate changes in appetite.

items.text: I eat even when I'm not hungry.
items.rationale: Eating without hunger is a sign of increased appetite.

items.text: I feel full quickly and can't finish meals.
items.rationale: Feeling full quickly is a symptom of decreased appetite.

items.text: I have to force myself to eat.
items.rationale: Forcing oneself to eat indicates a lack of appetite.

items.text: I snack more often than I used to.
items.rationale: Increased snacking is a sign of changes in appetite.

items.text: I feel nauseous at the thought of food.
items.rationale: Nausea at the thought of food is a strong indicator of decreased appetite.

items.text: I eat at odd times, like late at night.
items.rationale: Eating at unusual times can indicate changes in appetite.

items.text: I sometimes eat more when I'm stressed.
items.rationale: Stress eating can indicate changes in appetite but may also relate to stress coping.

items.text: I eat less when I'm busy.
items.rationale: Eating less due to busyness can indicate changes in appetite but may be situational.

items.text: I eat more when I'm feeling down.
items.rationale: Eating more when feeling down can relate to emotional eating or changes in appetite.

items.text: I have trouble falling asleep at night.
items.rationale: Difficulty falling asleep is a clear indicator of changes in sleeping patterns.

items.text: I wake up frequently during the night.
items.rationale: Frequent waking is a symptom of disrupted sleeping patterns.

items.text: I sleep much more than I used to.
items.rationale: Increased sleep duration is a sign of changes in sleeping patterns.

items.text: I can't seem to get enough sleep, no matter how long I sleep.
items.rationale: Feeling unrested despite long sleep is indicative of changes in sleeping patterns.

items.text: I wake up too early and can't fall back asleep.
items.rationale: Early waking with inability to return to sleep is a symptom of sleep pattern changes.

items.text: I feel sleepy during the day, even after a full night's sleep.
items.rationale: Daytime sleepiness despite adequate night sleep indicates sleep pattern issues.

items.text: I have vivid dreams that disrupt my sleep.
items.rationale: Disruptive vivid dreams are a sign of changes in sleeping patterns.

items.text: I find it hard to stay awake during the day.
items.rationale: Difficulty staying awake during the day is indicative of sleep pattern changes.

items.text: I feel like I need naps during the day.
items.rationale: Needing naps during the day suggests changes in sleeping patterns.

items.text: I have trouble waking up in the morning.
items.rationale: Difficulty waking up is a symptom of changes in sleeping patterns.

items.text: I feel like my sleep schedule is all over the place.
items.rationale: An irregular sleep schedule is a clear indicator of changes in sleeping patterns.

items.text: I sometimes stay up late and regret it the next day.
items.rationale: Staying up late occasionally can indicate changes in sleep patterns but may be situational.

items.text: I sleep in on weekends to catch up on sleep.
items.rationale: Sleeping in on weekends can indicate changes in sleep patterns but may be a lifestyle choice.

items.text: I feel tired all the time, even after sleeping well.
items.rationale: Constant tiredness can relate to sleep issues or loss of energy.

items.text: I cry more often than I used to.
items.rationale: Increased frequency of crying is a direct indicator of this factor.

items.text: I find myself crying for no apparent reason.
items.rationale: Crying without a clear reason is a strong indicator of this factor.

items.text: I feel like crying but hold it back.
items.rationale: Feeling the urge to cry but suppressing it is indicative of this factor.

items.text: I cry at things that never used to make me cry.
items.rationale: Crying at previously non-triggering events indicates a change in emotional response.

items.text: I cry when I'm alone.
items.rationale: Crying in solitude is a common behavior associated with this factor.

items.text: I feel like crying when I think about my problems.
items.rationale: Crying in response to personal problems is a direct indicator of this factor.

items.text: I cry when I feel overwhelmed.
items.rationale: Crying due to feeling overwhelmed is a clear sign of this factor.

items.text: I cry more easily than I used to.
items.rationale: Increased ease of crying is a direct indicator of this factor.

items.text: I feel like crying when I watch sad movies.
items.rationale: Crying in response to sad stimuli is a common behavior associated with this factor.

items.text: I cry when I feel helpless.
items.rationale: Crying due to feelings of helplessness is a direct indicator of this factor.

items.text: I cry when I think about the past.
items.rationale: Crying in response to past memories is a sign of this factor.

items.text: I sometimes cry when I'm frustrated.
items.rationale: Crying due to frustration can indicate this factor but may also relate to irritability.

items.text: I cry when I'm really tired.
items.rationale: Crying due to tiredness can indicate this factor but may also relate to loss of energy.

items.text: I feel like crying when I'm anxious.
items.rationale: Crying due to anxiety can relate to both crying and anxiety factors.

items.text: I have trouble focusing on tasks.
items.rationale: Trouble focusing is a direct indicator of difficulty concentrating.

items.text: I get easily distracted from what I'm doing.
items.rationale: Easily getting distracted is a clear sign of difficulty concentrating.

items.text: I can't seem to concentrate on reading.
items.rationale: Inability to concentrate on reading is a direct indicator of this factor.

items.text: I find it hard to follow conversations.
items.rationale: Difficulty following conversations is a sign of concentration issues.

items.text: I lose track of what I'm doing easily.
items.rationale: Losing track of tasks is a direct indicator of difficulty concentrating.

items.text: I have to reread things to understand them.
items.rationale: Needing to reread is a sign of concentration difficulties.

items.text: I find it hard to focus on work.
items.rationale: Difficulty focusing on work is a direct indicator of this factor.

items.text: I can't concentrate when there's noise around me.
items.rationale: Inability to concentrate in noisy environments is a sign of concentration issues.

items.text: I find it hard to concentrate on TV shows.
items.rationale: Difficulty concentrating on TV shows is a direct indicator of this factor.

items.text: I struggle to focus on tasks that require attention.
items.rationale: Struggling to focus on attention-requiring tasks is a sign of concentration issues.

items.text: I find my mind wandering during important tasks.
items.rationale: Mind wandering during important tasks is a direct indicator of this factor.

items.text: I sometimes zone out during conversations.
items.rationale: Zoning out can indicate concentration issues but may also relate to disinterest.

items.text: I find it hard to concentrate when I'm tired.
items.rationale: Difficulty concentrating when tired can indicate this factor but may relate to fatigue.

items.text: I can't focus when I'm feeling anxious.
items.rationale: Anxiety can impair concentration, overlapping with difficulty concentrating.

items.text: I feel guilty about things I've done in the past.
items.rationale: Feeling guilt about past actions is a direct indicator of guilty feelings.

items.text: I often think about how I've let others down.
items.rationale: Thinking about letting others down is a sign of guilty feelings.

items.text: I feel guilty even when I haven't done anything wrong.
items.rationale: Feeling guilt without wrongdoing is a strong indicator of this factor.

items.text: I feel like I'm a burden to others.
items.rationale: Feeling like a burden is a manifestation of guilty feelings.

items.text: I feel guilty for taking time for myself.
items.rationale: Guilt for self-care is a direct indicator of guilty feelings.

items.text: I feel guilty about not being able to do more.
items.rationale: Guilt about perceived inadequacy is a sign of guilty feelings.

items.text: I feel guilty when I make mistakes.
items.rationale: Guilt in response to mistakes is a direct indicator of this factor.

items.text: I feel guilty for things that are out of my control.
items.rationale: Guilt over uncontrollable events is a sign of guilty feelings.

items.text: I feel guilty when I say no to others.
items.rationale: Guilt from setting boundaries is a direct indicator of guilty feelings.

items.text: I feel guilty for not being perfect.
items.rationale: Guilt over imperfection is a sign of guilty feelings.

items.text: I feel guilty when I can't help others.
items.rationale: Guilt from inability to help is a direct indicator of this factor.

items.text: I sometimes feel guilty for no clear reason.
items.rationale: Unexplained guilt can indicate this factor but may also relate to anxiety.

items.text: I feel guilty when I'm not productive.
items.rationale: Guilt from lack of productivity can indicate this factor but may relate to self-esteem.

items.text: I feel guilty when I'm irritable with others.
items.rationale: Guilt from irritability can relate to both guilty feelings and irritability.

items.text: I have trouble making decisions.
items.rationale: Difficulty making decisions is a direct indicator of indecisiveness.

items.text: I second-guess my choices often.
items.rationale: Frequent second-guessing is a sign of indecisiveness.

items.text: I feel paralyzed when faced with decisions.
items.rationale: Feeling paralyzed by decisions is a strong indicator of this factor.

items.text: I take a long time to make even simple decisions.
items.rationale: Prolonged decision-making is a direct indicator of indecisiveness.

items.text: I often change my mind after making a decision.
items.rationale: Changing decisions frequently is a sign of indecisiveness.

items.text: I feel anxious about making the wrong choice.
items.rationale: Anxiety about choices is a direct indicator of indecisiveness.

items.text: I avoid making decisions whenever possible.
items.rationale: Avoidance of decision-making is a sign of indecisiveness.

items.text: I ask others to make decisions for me.
items.rationale: Relying on others for decisions is a direct indicator of indecisiveness.

items.text: I feel overwhelmed by choices.
items.rationale: Feeling overwhelmed by choices is a sign of indecisiveness.

items.text: I struggle to decide what to do with my time.
items.rationale: Difficulty deciding on time use is a direct indicator of indecisiveness.

items.text: I often regret my decisions.
items.rationale: Regret over decisions is a sign of indecisiveness.

items.text: I sometimes feel stuck when making decisions.
items.rationale: Feeling stuck can indicate indecisiveness but may also relate to anxiety.

items.text: I find it hard to choose between similar options.
items.rationale: Difficulty choosing between similar options can indicate indecisiveness but may relate to perfectionism.

items.text: I feel anxious when I have to make a decision.
items.rationale: Anxiety during decision-making can relate to both indecisiveness and anxiety.

items.text: I get irritated easily.
items.rationale: Easily getting irritated is a direct indicator of irritability.

items.text: I snap at people over small things.
items.rationale: Snapping over minor issues is a sign of irritability.

items.text: I feel annoyed by things that never used to bother me.
items.rationale: Increased annoyance is a direct indicator of irritability.

items.text: I have a short fuse lately.
items.rationale: Having a short temper is a sign of irritability.

items.text: I feel like I'm on edge all the time.
items.rationale: Constant edginess is a direct indicator of irritability.

items.text: I get frustrated easily.
items.rationale: Easily getting frustrated is a sign of irritability.

items.text: I feel like I can't tolerate others' mistakes.
items.rationale: Low tolerance for mistakes is a direct indicator of irritability.

items.text: I feel like I'm always in a bad mood.
items.rationale: Constant bad mood is a sign of irritability.

items.text: I get angry over things that don't matter.
items.rationale: Anger over trivial matters is a direct indicator of irritability.

items.text: I feel like I can't control my temper.
items.rationale: Inability to control temper is a sign of irritability.

items.text: I feel like I'm always ready to argue.
items.rationale: Readiness to argue is a direct indicator of irritability.

items.text: I sometimes feel irritable when I'm tired.
items.rationale: Irritability when tired can indicate this factor but may relate to fatigue.

items.text: I get annoyed when things don't go my way.
items.rationale: Annoyance at unmet expectations can indicate irritability but may relate to control issues.

items.text: I feel irritable when I'm anxious.
items.rationale: Irritability due to anxiety can relate to both irritability and anxiety.

items.text: I feel exhausted all the time.
items.rationale: Constant exhaustion is a direct indicator of loss of energy.

items.text: I have no energy to do the things I used to enjoy.
items.rationale: Lack of energy for enjoyable activities is a sign of loss of energy.

items.text: I feel drained even after a good night's sleep.
items.rationale: Feeling drained despite rest is a direct indicator of loss of energy.

items.text: I have to push myself to get through the day.
items.rationale: Needing to push oneself is a sign of loss of energy.

items.text: I feel like I have no stamina.
items.rationale: Lack of stamina is a direct indicator of loss of energy.

items.text: I feel too tired to do basic tasks.
items.rationale: Excessive tiredness for basic tasks is a sign of loss of energy.

items.text: I feel like I'm running on empty.
items.rationale: Feeling depleted is a direct indicator of loss of energy.

items.text: I feel like I can't keep up with my responsibilities.
items.rationale: Inability to keep up is a sign of loss of energy.

items.text: I feel like I need to rest all the time.

items.text: I feel like I have no motivation to do anything.
items.rationale: Lack of motivation is a sign of loss of energy.

items.text: I feel like I can't get going in the morning.
items.rationale: Difficulty starting the day is a direct indicator of loss of energy.

items.text: I sometimes feel tired even after resting.
items.rationale: Feeling tired after rest can indicate loss of energy but may relate to sleep issues.

items.text: I feel like I have less energy than I used to.

items.text: I feel tired when I'm feeling down.

items.text: I no longer enjoy activities I used to love.

items.text: I feel like I have no passion for anything.

items.text: I have little or no interest in sexual activity.

items.rationale: Self-criticism suggests self-criticalness.

items.text: I often think about how I could have done better.
items.rationale: Focus on improvement indicates self-criticalness.

items.text: I feel like I constantly let myself down.
items.rationale: Feeling of self-disappointment suggests self-criticalness.

items.text: I often feel like I'm not living up to my potential.
items.rationale: Feeling of underachievement indicates self-criticalness.

items.text: I feel like I should be more successful.
items.rationale: Desire for success suggests self-criticalness.

items.text: I often think about my weaknesses.
items.rationale: Focus on weaknesses indicates self-criticalness.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I should be kinder to myself.
items.rationale: Ambiguous as it could relate to self-dislike.

items.text: I wonder why I'm so hard on myself.
items.rationale: Could relate to self-dislike or confusion.

items.text: I feel sad when I think about my shortcomings.
items.rationale: Could map to Sadness due to the mention of feeling sad.

items.text: I often dislike myself.
items.rationale: Directly indicates self-dislike.

items.text: I feel like I'm not a good person.
items.rationale: Feeling of being a bad person suggests self-dislike.

items.text: I often feel ashamed of who I am.
items.rationale: Shame about self indicates self-dislike.

items.text: I feel like I don't deserve love.
items.rationale: Feeling undeserving of love suggests self-dislike.

items.text: I often feel like I'm not worth much.
items.rationale: Feeling of low worth indicates self-dislike.

items.text: I feel like I don't like myself very much.
items.rationale: Dislike of self suggests self-dislike.

items.text: I often feel like I'm a failure.
items.rationale: Feeling of failure indicates self-dislike.

items.text: I feel like I'm not a likable person.
items.rationale: Feeling unlikable suggests self-dislike.

items.text: I often feel like I'm not good enough for others.
items.rationale: Feeling of inadequacy for others indicates self-dislike.

items.text: I feel like I don't measure up to others.
items.rationale: Feeling of not measuring up suggests self-dislike.

items.text: I often feel like I'm a disappointment.
items.rationale: Feeling of being a disappointment indicates self-dislike.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I should like myself more.
items.rationale: Ambiguous as it could relate to self-criticalness.

items.text: I wonder why I don't like myself.
items.rationale: Could relate to self-criticalness or confusion.

items.text: I feel sad when I think about how I dislike myself.
items.rationale: Could map to Sadness due to the mention of feeling sad.

items.text: I often think about ending my life.
items.rationale: Directly indicates suicidal thoughts.

items.text: I feel like life isn't worth living.
items.rationale: Feeling life isn't worth living suggests suicidal thoughts.

items.text: I often wish I could disappear.
items.rationale: Wishing to disappear indicates suicidal thoughts.

items.text: I feel like the world would be better off without me.
items.rationale: Feeling the world is better off without suggests suicidal thoughts.

items.text: I often think about how to end my suffering.
items.rationale: Thoughts of ending suffering indicate suicidal thoughts.

items.text: I feel like I have no reason to live.
items.rationale: Feeling of no reason to live suggests suicidal thoughts.

items.text: I often think about how to escape my pain.
items.rationale: Thoughts of escape indicate suicidal thoughts.

items.text: I feel like I can't go on living like this.
items.rationale: Feeling of inability to continue suggests suicidal thoughts.

items.text: I often think about how to make the pain stop.
items.rationale: Thoughts of stopping pain indicate suicidal thoughts.

items.text: I feel like I want to end it all.
items.rationale: Desire to end it all suggests suicidal thoughts.

items.text: I often think about how to end my life.
items.rationale: Directly indicates suicidal thoughts.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I should talk to someone about my thoughts.
items.rationale: Ambiguous as it could relate to seeking help.

items.text: I wonder why I have these thoughts.
items.rationale: Could relate to confusion or self-criticalness.

items.text: I feel sad when I think about ending my life.
items.rationale: Could map to Sadness due to the mention of feeling sad.

items.text: I often feel exhausted for no reason.
items.rationale: Directly indicates unexplained tiredness.

items.text: I feel like I have no energy to do anything.
items.rationale: Lack of energy suggests tiredness or fatigue.

items.text: I often feel drained even after resting.
items.rationale: Feeling drained after rest indicates tiredness or fatigue.

items.text: I feel like I can't keep my eyes open.
items.rationale: Difficulty staying awake suggests tiredness or fatigue.

items.text: I feel like I'm always tired no matter what I do.
items.rationale: Constant tiredness indicates tiredness or fatigue.

items.text: I feel like I have to push myself to get through the day.
items.rationale: Need to push oneself suggests tiredness or fatigue.

items.text: I often feel like I need to lie down.
items.rationale: Desire to lie down indicates tiredness or fatigue.

items.text: I feel like I can't muster the energy to do anything.
items.rationale: Lack of energy suggests tiredness or fatigue.

items.text: I feel like I'm running on empty.
items.rationale: Feeling of emptiness indicates tiredness or fatigue.

items.text: I feel like I need more sleep than usual.
items.rationale: Increased need for sleep suggests tiredness or fatigue.

items.text: I often feel like I can't get out of bed.
items.rationale: Difficulty getting out of bed indicates tiredness or fatigue.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I should have more energy.
items.rationale: Ambiguous as it could relate to self-criticalness.

items.text: I wonder why I'm always so tired.
items.rationale: Could relate to confusion or self-criticalness.

items.text: I feel sad when I think about how tired I am.
items.rationale: Could map to Sadness due to the mention of feeling sad.

items.text: I feel like I'm a burden to others.
items.rationale: Feeling like a burden is a direct expression of worthlessness.

items.text: I don't think I have anything valuable to offer.
items.rationale: Believing one has nothing valuable to offer is a clear sign of worthlessness.

items.text: I often feel like I'm not good enough.
items.rationale: Feeling inadequate is a core aspect of worthlessness.

items.text: I frequently doubt my abilities.
items.rationale: Doubting one's abilities is indicative of feelings of worthlessness.

items.text: I feel like I don't deserve good things.
items.rationale: Believing one doesn't deserve good things is a manifestation of worthlessness.

items.text: I often think others are better than me.
items.rationale: Comparing oneself unfavorably to others is a sign of worthlessness.

items.text: I feel like a failure.
items.rationale: Feeling like a failure is a direct expression of worthlessness.

items.text: I don't see any point in trying because I won't succeed.
items.rationale: Believing that efforts are futile due to anticipated failure is a sign of worthlessness.

items.text: I feel like I'm not important to anyone.
items.rationale: Feeling unimportant is a core aspect of worthlessness.

items.text: I think my life doesn't matter.
items.rationale: Believing one's life lacks significance is indicative of worthlessness.

items.text: I feel like I have no purpose.
items.rationale: Feeling purposeless is a manifestation of worthlessness.

items.text: I often feel like I'm just taking up space.
items.rationale: Feeling like one is merely occupying space is a sign of worthlessness.

items.text: Sometimes I feel like I don't fit in anywhere.
items.rationale: Feeling like one doesn't fit in can indicate worthlessness but may also relate to social anxiety.

items.text: I occasionally think my contributions don't matter.
items.rationale: Doubting the value of one's contributions suggests worthlessness but could also relate to low self-esteem.

items.text: I feel like I lack motivation to do anything.
items.rationale: Lack of motivation can be a result of worthlessness but also maps to depression.
